thread.title: Tom Hardy's no longer the bookies favourite to be the next James Bond | Metro News
thread.title_full: Tom Hardy's no longer the bookies favourite to be the next James Bond | Metro News

author: Elizabeth Adetula For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Tom Hardy's no longer the bookies favourite to be the next James Bond | Metro News
text:
Elizabeth Adetula for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 5:05 pm Has Tom got a license to kill? (Picture: REX Features/Getty) 
Tom Hardy has been pushed aside in the race to become the next James Bond, according to the bookies. Just Kate Winslet and Idris Elba sharing a kiss on the set of their new movie 
Actors James Norton and Michael Fassbender are now the bookies favourites to be granted a license to kill and it’s getting really close. 
According to Coral, both Norton and Fassbender are at 5/2 to take over from Daniel Craig, but according to William Hill’s bets Fassbender is in the lead with 5/2 and Norton follows closely with 4/1. 
Hardy follows in close contention at both of the bookies at 11/4. Michael Fassbender and James Norton are currently in the lead (Picture: REX) 
Describing Norton’s shortening odds, Dan Stevens from Coral said: ‘Out of nowhere we’ve been hit with a surge of bets for Norton to be the next Bond. Even after slashing the odds to 5/2 we are still seeing money for the actor, leaving us both shaken and stirred.’
